intro: Dianthera ensiformis, commonly known as the narrowleaf dianthera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniacaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Dianthera ensiformis is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
